definition[0]: to become firm, steady, or unchanging, or to make something firm or steady
example[0]: The patient’s condition has now stabilized.
example[1]: an attempt to stabilize the economy
definition[1]: to become firm, steady, or unchanging, or to make something do this
example[2]: We want to stabilize consumerprices for sugar and sugar products.
example[3]: the government’s plan to stabilize the economy
example[4]: Intervention can only play a limited role in stabilizing currency exchange rates.
example[5]: Calm returned to Wall Street as financial markets stabilized around the world.
